identity.name: yoURFest 2026
identity.tagline: The ultimate convergence of technology, culture, and retro-futurism.
identity.ethos: A high-depth festival management platform with a 'Cyber-Retro' or 'Y2K-Cyberpunk' aesthetic. Emphasis on neon accents, sharp pixel edges, and industrial transparency.

logo_logic.style: Text-shadow intensive (Neon Yellow glow for main, Neon Purple for suffix)

tech_stack.animations: Framer Motion (Transitions, Hover states, Pulse effects)
tech_stack.ui_library: Shadcn UI (customized for sharp corners and neon shadows)

visual_effects: Neon outer glows on cards and headers

core_components.PixelCard: Standard container with :root --radius: 0px. Hover: { y: -4, x: -4, box-shadow: 8px 8px 0px 0px ${shadowColor} } plus a matching color outer glow.
core_components.GlitchText: Stack of 3 spans (relative z-10 for main, absolute -z-10 for cyan/purple aberration). Hover: opacity-60, animate-pulse, and Â±2px translate-x shift.
core_components.Navigation: Sticky with backdrop-filter: blur-lg. Logo features 'yoURFest' in primary with '2026' as a secondary colored superscript/suffix. Links have motion.div layoutId='underline' for active state.
core_components.Footer: Grid-based with 4 columns: Branding, Quick Links, Contact (Lucide icons in secondary color), and Social (Icon buttons with border-2 hover effects).

features: Department filtering (CSE/AIML, MECH, IT, ECE/EEE, General, Cultural)
Simulated success state with toast notifications

vibecoding_instructions: Mandatory pixelated aesthetics: All components must use --radius: 0px.
Individual Participation: All events are strictly individual (Team Size: 1).
Department Centric: Filtering must be driven by Department rather than just broad Tech/Cultural categories.
Prize Standardization: Every single event must offer 'Cash Prize & Certificates' as the reward.
Dynamic data: Keep UI stateful. Even if data is static now, structure components to consume props correctly.
Motion design: Every button hover should trigger a physical translation (translation-x/y) or a glow shift.
SEO: Ensure every page has a single H1 with appropriate semantic hierarchy.
